i took the online version... it was great! i enjoyed the flexibility of the class. i learned so much without all of the time being put into. he responded to emails quickly, which is helpful considering its online class. take this class you won't regret it :)

Great professor and fun guy. Don't need the textbook. I took the LR class two days a week and it seemed much better than the 4 day course. Need to go to class to take easy lecture quiz and get participation points.
Straightforward, easy, pretty funny too
Good teacher. just by the plays and not the textbook, you don't need it. Easy note quizzes, but you have to show up to class to take them
Awesome professor.  So cool and original-  I wish all professors were like him.
Easiest class I have taken at OSU.  Skipped class all of the time and bought the notes from Buckeye Class Notes and made an A.  Recommend taking this class to boost GPA
Funny guy, easy class to fulfill a GEC add this class to have a easier quarter or to take more credits little work required rewarding experience
He was one of the best teachers I've ever had. He was really funny and his lectures were extremely interesting. I loved this class and it was really easy.

VERY funny teacher. I recommended him to all of my friends. Easy A for the class. All you have to do is read the plays or look on sparknotes for help for the quizzes. All lecture quizzes are open note. :) Very fun class :D

Dr. Dekker is HILARIOUS! He is a great teacher, and does anything he can to get people to understand. He also gives pop quizzes, but his lectures are fun so its not too bad to go to them. I recommend him to everyone!

This is probably the easiest class at the entire university. I took it to fufill a GEC requirement, but definately take it if u need a boost for your GPA. Dekker is an awesome teacher, no book needed, just go to class and take the notes and it's a breeze. The project can be a little time consuming so don't put it off
easiest class ever. go the lecture because there are pop quizzes.

An absolutely brilliant prof. Super cute and very intelligent. He makes the class fun and keeps the topic interesting. I love how he incorporates his nuggets of knowledge about dark beer. I wish he taught more classes.
definitely take the online class...easyyyyyyy as can be!
I took this class as a GEC and enjoyed it. He tries to keep you involved - it's a huge lecture so you don't HAVE to go... but there are pop quizzes, so I reccomend going. Sweet guy!
Easy! Go to class- pop quizzes.

Dr. Dekker is enthusiastic, but I prefered his substitute. He only lectures and leaves the teaching to the GA's in recitation. Exams are off the notes, so go to class, because there are no study guides. Hope for an easy GA, because they make or break your grade. Easy GEC, easy pass.

Take this class! Deckker is entertaining and makes lectures easy to sit through. Has a great personality.  IF YOU GO TO CLASS AND TAKE THE NOTES YOU'LL GET AN A. Tests are based off of lectures. Easy GEC. TAKE IT!
I was afraid to take this class, but it was so easy and enjoyable. If you attend class you will receive all of the points you need to get an A in the class for a level 100 course.

Dr. Dekker was extremely nice and enthusiastic. Although he covers an enormous amount of material, all of the information is very clear. Attendance isn't mandatory but w/out the notes you'll fail the class.
vey helpful and fuuny in class
Very hard class made very easy. Love to talk movies so its a good way to get him off topic ;) Pretty easy grader but it doesn't mean you can blow off. Put some effort into it.

He made class so much fun. He was so enthusastic and just basically awesome. It was probably my favorite class at OSU so far. He's a great guy and if you take this class, you should def. try to get him as your TA.  Plus, he gives out candy on the last day of class. That's how cool he is.
Freakin' Great, Man! Way to be AWESOME!!!!

Nick is the best teacher I've ever had at OSU.  He makes coming to lecture worthwhile and fun!  I wasn't interested in theatre before this class, now I actually am.  He's so enthusiastic and hilarious that it makes class fly by.

Looking past the corny jokes and his psychotic  obsessesion with Star Wars, Nick is so cool!  He, makes class interesting and you can really tell he loves theatre which makes it that much more fun to learn.  I would recommend going to lecture simply to be entertained.
Nick Rocks.   Even though he is a nerd (and he admits it), he is the coolest nerd ever.   Oh yeah, he is very helpful and makes class interesting with stories and such.
Very good professor.Has excellent knowledge of reading material. Love his humor!
Good teacher- very helpful.class material is current.

I took this class because I heard that Dr Hill is highly regarded as one of the best in this field-it was an excellent class!He is very knowledgeable and was extremely helpful.He always took the time to assist-a good teacher in this field. As most professors who've published, he does use one of his books as a text.(Not uncommon) Great Plays!
Very helpful and also learned a lot in Dr Hill's class. He is one of the best in a Theatre Dept that typically has boring teachers.
Amazing professor, I've known him a long time. Great knowledge of the subject matter, easy A if you come to class and do some of the readings (which are usually pretty interesting).

Not sure if the prof was great OR that the class was super easy.  Papers were more about content than writing ability.  Very easy to get an A:  attend class, do the assignments, MAYBE study for the midterm.  Was allowed to work together with classmates on the final.  One 6 page research paper, weekly SHORT writing assignments.
excellent prof -and good material used.
very good defin knows his subj /field-  liked the plays we discussed. good class.
Easy A if you put a LOT of work into it. Attendance is worth a lot of points and there is busy work due almost daily. He is very disorganized and had to change the syllabus several times.
good prof- knows his stuff. lectures r good.
No Comments
boring lectures but the ta's go over everything that is on the test... i recommend taking this class for your 2nd writing course
No Comments
Fairly easy class, very redundant lectures though.....takes attendance and you lose lots of points if you dont go....
Great lecturer, very interesting class
The most enjoyable class that I've had at OSU. He was a really nice guy who really loves his craft and helps you understand it well. Amazing Instructor!!
He is an awesome professor. His class is actually fun. Strongly recommend.

Kal is a really good professor and a sweetheart.  He took an actual investment in every student and was always fully into the discussion at hand.  While some exercises seemed a bit tedious at times, Kal always managed to make them fun and give them a definitive purpose.
Kal is a great teacher - fun class
No Comments
Love Kal!! Very understanding and easy. Organized and fun.

I think this was his last quarter teaching, so this rating is probably irrelevant. Anyway, interesting class, very easy. Lectures were kind of boring and pointless but attendance was taken and part of the grade. TAs did most of the teaching and handled grades. ..Still waiting on the grades, actually.. Overall, great, funny guy. He'll be missed!

He was never on point, but his class was certainly interesting.  His TA's did most of the teachiing, but the work was miniscule and easy. None the less he did open my mind to all things controversial and to why censorship is so hard to box into the should~ should not category. I enjoyed his class.

Simply put: the worst class/professor I've had at Ohio State. Most of the lectures were irrelevant to the topic, never stayed on the syllabus, showed us things in class simply to shock us/because he could. There is no way I could ever recommend him to anyone for anything.
He was difficult to hear and talked about random topics that were not on the syllabus. No notes or real lecture, you just sit there and listen. The class was unorganized.
Great professor, take him for any class he teaches, I also took him for 367.01 it was great as well. Great professor all around
nicest guy, easy class, very fun and open minded
Robin will definitely challenge you, but the experience is SO rewarding!  InterACT is amazing, and I've learned more from her than any of my other professors so far.

Inter*ACT is an amazing experience.  It's a new course that just began fall 2006 and I couldn't imagine having anyone else teach the class, besides Robin.  She is extremely helpful, understanding, and always available to her students. She rocks. Honestly.
She is a great teacher. I hope she conitnues to teach in the area.

Very interested in what she's teaching, which comes through in the readings and video clips she shows us. Genuinely interested in listening to her students thoughts. Overall very entertaining and compelling class. She really knows her stuff and is particularly articulate.

pretty easy class, if you are interested in theater. honestly though, this class kind of made me HATE theater. You have to go and see plays ($10 tickets) and then write papers/take tests on them. the exams are over lecture notes only.. and there are lecture pop quizzes that can make or break your grade. but 9pt extra credit for seeing 3 extra plays

The lectures are boring. All you do is write notes (which you will use to study for the midterm and final). There are surprise pop quizzes which are there just for the sake of making people attend...you can have turns to go to class with your friends and each person can turn in quizzes for their friends. Grades depend on the TA and not the lecturer
Scott made comedy really fun to write and perform. I felt like he wanted us to be creative AND learn at the same time. Plus, he looks like Seth Rogen.

Scott was fun, energetic, and fully immersed in the material without taking it, the class, or himself too seriously.  Always able to punch up a topic with his quick wit and lighthearted mentality, he made the class enjoyable while keeping it educationally valuable.  I would DEFINITELY recommend him to other students.
Super fun and good at what he does. Always there to help!

Theatre 100 is the easiest classes possible if you have a good TA.  Scott is one of them.  Don't buy the text or the workbook, just go to class. He's really nice and he is one of the cool grad students who will get to know you.  Easygoing. Does his besto give you an A.
Another grad student, Scott is a great teacher and always willing to help out whether or not you're still in one of his classes. He's also very amusing and usually in 2 or 3 plays a year.

I took her for my 367 class. Class was interesting, we read good plays and watched a lot of movies. The project was easy, the midterm had like 15 multiple choice questions. I forgot a paper once and she let me drop it off later. Take her if you can.

The workload was really light for a writing class. The material was interesting and we spent a lot of class time watching movies/plays. I only wish I had borrowed all the books instead of buying them because the test material came from notes/lectures.
Class is somewhat easy. The class should be out of more points. The class can be sort of boring because she kinda lacks a personality. Read the plays and you'll be fine.

Super easy class, the only bad side is that the whole class is only out of 100 points, so each little bit counts. Basically just read plays and do short little activities. You have to write one paper but the topic is broad and you can make it about movies or TV. Have to do a short presentation at the the end of the quarter.
fairly easy class, great for 2nd writing requirement if you're interested in plays and theatre. I just wish she could have facilitated discussion better. Lack therof made class kinda dull.

Stick figure with her own performances to worry about outside of class. Easy class, felt like I paid for nothing. No challenge. She didn't even complete the writing assignments or quizzes for the quarter had to give us the points at the end for free. Worthless professor, didn't teach anything, especially writing. Read plays, watched film clips.

Christina is a wonderful teacher.  Very knowledgeable on the topic of the American Stage.  I would most certainly take another class taught by her.  I think she is certainly coming into her own as a Professor, and will only get better.

Just getting her PhD, and will be teaching at OSU as a professor in the fall. She taught 210, script analysis, and it took the first project and talking with her to determine her expectations, but after that, the class is relatively straightforward, if not a bit too fast.

Amazing class taught by an amazing teacher. Chris is so helpful, and really makes you think about why things are the way they are. He is also very down to earth and you feel like youre going to class to just hang out. The first half of the class relies heavily on the book... so read it! And work hard on your final, all he wants is good effort.
Amazing. Take any class he teaches!!!!
Awesome guy, best class at OSU. He is fun, clear, but makes you get to work and helps you produce some of the best things ever. Great guy. Nothing but praise for him.
Chris Roche is pretty much my hero! take this class! It makes me all warm and fuzzy inside
An amazing person all around! He is the most genunie adorable fantastic graduate teacher on this planet! Take a class with him before he graduates!
Roche friggin rules, and will make the hottest Frank-n-furter ever!

O MY GOD HE IS SOOO COOL!  he was the best theater teacher i have had in my entire life.  he's down to earth, honest, and encouraging...so much so i still have the notes he gave me for the final monologue.  i love him to death!
I LOVED THIS MAN! I wish he taught my entire undergraduate career.
Chris is awesome.  He really helps you and is very nice.  I would definitely recommend taking a class from him.
Chris is very funny.  You usually get out of class early which is awesome.  He is always willing to help.  It is easy to stay awake in his class, you will want to go.
